guest_info.name: Christian Bachelder
guest_info.title: Co-Founder
guest_info.production_level: Ranked in the top 20 brokerages by funded loan value in 2021 and 2022
guest_info.specialty: Real estate lending and investment strategies

main_topics: The one house a year strategy
Impact of institutional buyers on the market

problems_addressed.specific_problem: Low inventory and high competition in the real estate market
problems_addressed.solution_summary: Consider buying properties now despite high rates due to less competition and potential discounts.
Explore creative solutions such as co-signers or qualifying as a household to secure financing.

target_avatars.relevance: This episode provides insights into leveraging real estate investment as a retirement strategy.
target_avatars.key_takeaway: Consider the one house a year strategy to build long-term wealth and financial security.

clip_worthy_moments.quote: If you don't buy real estate in the next five to ten years, I'm not sure you will be able to after that.
clip_worthy_moments.why_clipworthy: It challenges the listener to act quickly in the real estate market.
clip_worthy_moments.suggested_hook: Why waiting to buy real estate might cost you more than you think.

key_tactics.tactic: Implement the one house a year strategy
key_tactics.context: Buy one property each year as a primary residence and convert previous homes to rentals.

quotable_insights: Date the rate, marry the house.

resources_mentioned.name: The One Brokerage
resources_mentioned.context: Christian's company offering nationwide lending solutions.

episode_summary: In this episode, Christian Bachelder discusses innovative real estate investment strategies, including the one house a year approach as a replacement for traditional retirement savings. He addresses current market challenges like low inventory and high competition, offering creative financing solutions to overcome these hurdles. This episode is essential for agents looking to educate clients on building long-term wealth through real estate.
